dkeep.logic

Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • dkeep.logic.Level
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DungeonLevel, OgreLevel

    public abstract class Level
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Level(Map currentmap, int Ogrenmb, int Guardtype)
      Constructs a Level, setting the current map and the other elements (Hero, Enemies - Ogres/Guard, Doors and key)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean changeLevel()
      Verifies if it's time to change to the next Level
      Map getCurrentMap()
      Gets the Map that represents the current Level
      Character getFirstEnemie()
      Gets the 1st enemy from the enemies' ArrayList - used mainly to get the Guard in the 1st Level
      Hero getHero()
      Gets the actual hero
      char[][] getMap()
      Gets a copy of the actual game's matrix without the game's elements and set them on it
      void InitalizeElements(int Ogrenmb, int Guardtype)
      Runs the map matrix and set the elements (Hero, Enemies - Ogres/Guard, Doors and key)
      void IstoMoveElements(boolean movement)
      Sets if it's supposed to move enemies during the game or not
      abstract Level nextLevel(int enemienmb)
      Gives an instance of the next level with the number of enemies (Ogres)
      void printMap()
      Gets a copy of the actual matrix game with all the elements (hero, enemies, doors and key) and prints it as a String
      Level.state updateGame(char move)
      Updates all the Game elements verifying collisions
      Level.state updateGameStatus(char move)
      Updates the Game Status calling the updateGame function and verifying the return state to print a Status message

    • Constructor Detail

      • Level

        public Level(Map currentmap,
             int Ogrenmb,
             int Guardtype)
        Constructs a Level, setting the current map and the other elements (Hero, Enemies - Ogres/Guard, Doors and key)
        Parameters:
        currentmap - Map to use during the level
        Ogrenmb - Number of Ogres that will exist during the 2nd Level
        Guardtype - Guard's Type to be used in the 1st Level ( 1 - Drunken , 2 - Suspicious, 3 - Rookie)

    • Method Detail

      • InitalizeElements

        public void InitalizeElements(int Ogrenmb,
                              int Guardtype)
        Runs the map matrix and set the elements (Hero, Enemies - Ogres/Guard, Doors and key)
        Parameters:
        Ogrenmb - Number of Ogres to be generated
        Guardtype - Guard's Type to be used in the 1st Level ( 1 - Drunken , 2 - Suspicious, 3 - Rookie)

      • updateGame

        public Level.state updateGame(char move)
        Updates all the Game elements verifying collisions
        Parameters:
        move - WASD key representing the hero's movement
        Returns:
        Returns the state enum of the game State (Running, NextLevel or Lose)

      • getHero

        public Hero getHero()
        Gets the actual hero
        Returns:
        Returns the hero

      • changeLevel

        public boolean changeLevel()
        Verifies if it's time to change to the next Level
        Returns:
        Returns true if it's supposed to move to the next Level, and false if not

      • nextLevel

        public abstract Level nextLevel(int enemienmb)
        Gives an instance of the next level with the number of enemies (Ogres)
        Parameters:
        enemienmb - Number of enemies that should exist in the next level
        Returns:
        Returns an instance of the new Level

      • IstoMoveElements

        public void IstoMoveElements(boolean movement)
        Sets if it's supposed to move enemies during the game or not
        Parameters:
        movement - True if it supposed to move enemies and false if not

      • getMap

        public char[][] getMap()
        Gets a copy of the actual game's matrix without the game's elements and set them on it
        Returns:
        Returns a char matrix with all the game's elements

      • printMap

        public void printMap()
        Gets a copy of the actual matrix game with all the elements (hero, enemies, doors and key) and prints it as a String

      • getFirstEnemie

        public Character getFirstEnemie()
        Gets the 1st enemy from the enemies' ArrayList - used mainly to get the Guard in the 1st Level
        Returns:
        Returns the 1st enemy from the enemies' ArrayList

      • updateGameStatus

        public Level.state updateGameStatus(char move)
        Updates the Game Status calling the updateGame function and verifying the return state to print a Status message
        Parameters:
        move - WASD char that represents the hero's movement
        Returns:
        Returns the state that receives from calling updateGame function

      • getCurrentMap

        public Map getCurrentMap()
        Gets the Map that represents the current Level
        Returns:
        Returns the currentMap
